channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 周四，阿富汗坎大哈发生一起自杀式爆炸事件，造成至少 20 人死亡，其中包括塔利班成员，医院工作人员说，这起血腥事件提醒人们，自美国领导的战争结束以来，阿富汗仍然存在威胁。
item.description:
A suicide bombing in Kandahar, Afghanistan, on Thursday killed at least 20 people, including Taliban members, hospital staff said, in a bloody reminder of the threats that persist in the country since the U.S.-led war ended. https://t.co/XWrcN54Au2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 在女足世界杯上亲吻一名球员后辞职的西班牙足球官员路易斯-鲁比亚莱斯（Luis Rubiales）面临西班牙调查人员的逮捕，他们正在调查对他的腐败和洗钱指控。
item.description:
Luis Rubiales, the Spanish soccer official who resigned after kissing a player at the Women’s World Cup, faces arrest by Spanish investigators who are looking into accusations of corruption and money laundering. https://t.co/vEAnK69Psg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 墨西哥最强大的犯罪团伙之一 "哈利斯科新生代 "运营着一个呼叫中心，提供购买退休人员度假房产的服务。然后，他们会清空受害者的银行账户。
item.description:
One of Mexico’s most powerful criminal groups, Jalisco New Generation, runs call centers that offer to buy retirees’ vacation properties. Then, they empty their victims’ bank accounts. https://t.co/6X2etIWimP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 印度最大的反对党指责国家当局在关键的大选前几周因税务纠纷阻止该党使用银行账户，从而使其政治活动陷入瘫痪。
item.description:
India’s largest opposition party accused the national authorities of paralyzing its political activities by blocking the party’s access to its bank accounts in a tax dispute just weeks before a pivotal general election. https://t.co/NIsMatYZoS

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 据当地官员称，俄罗斯导弹周四早些时候突入基辅，对乌克兰首都发动了数周来最大规模的袭击，造成至少 13 人受伤，数栋居民楼和工业设施受损。
item.description:
Russian missiles streaked into Kyiv early Thursday in the biggest assault on the Ukrainian capital in weeks, injuring at least 13 people and damaging several residential buildings and industrial facilities, according to local officials. https://t.co/sXru57mfLc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 切加党将自己视为消除选民不满情绪的解药，这既扰乱了葡萄牙政坛，也给整个欧洲体制注入了新的焦虑。
item.description:
The Chega party has cast itself as the antidote for voter discontent, both unsettling Portuguese politics and injecting new anxiety throughout the European establishment. https://t.co/1y1NImQXjr

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 弗兰斯-德瓦尔（Frans de Waal）利用他对动物内心世界的研究，有力地证明了猿类会思考、感受、制定战略、传承文化并根据道德情感行事--人类并不像我们许多人认为的那样特殊--他去世了，享年 75 岁。
item.description:
Frans de Waal, who used his study of the inner lives of animals to build a powerful case that apes think, feel, strategize, pass down culture and act on moral sentiments — and that humans are not as special as many of us like to think — has died at 75. https://t.co/jNHIdBQPDs

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 英国上议院在一次罕见的反抗中，暂时阻止了一项将寻求庇护者送往卢旺达的法律，这是首相苏纳克的移民议程的核心内容。
item.description:
Britain’s House of Lords, in a rare show of defiance, temporarily blocked a law that would send asylum seekers to Rwanda, a centerpiece of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s immigration agenda. https://t.co/74Gb31WwcK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 火山爆发的影响波及半岛以外地区，扰乱了这个严重依赖游客的国家的旅游业务
item.description:
The effects of the volcanic eruptions rippled out beyond the peninsula, disrupting the tourism operations of a country that relies heavily on visitors https://t.co/mm9xKoACsY

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 一位艺术家说，基于性别的歧视是她在澳大利亚创作的女性专属艺术装置的核心，但一位参观者声称这也是非法的。
item.description:
An artist says gender-based discrimination is central to her women-only art installation in Australia, but one visitor claims it is also illegal. https://t.co/GkjpO4LPhN

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 没有树木的林冠漫步。东欧的一个项目突显了维克托-欧尔班的政党如何将欧盟资金输送给其支持者。
item.description:
A forest canopy walk without trees. A project in eastern Europe highlights how Viktor Orban’s party channels E.U. funds to its supporters. https://t.co/cYRpn5emsx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 欧盟计划利用冻结在欧洲的俄罗斯资产所赚取的利息来筹集数十亿美元。但是，支付新武器费用的其他途径仍然遥遥无期。
item.description:
Using interest earned on frozen Russian assets held in Europe, the European Union plans to raise billions. But other ways to pay for new weapons remain elusive. https://t.co/seGd0kXfr0

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 巴西警方建议对前总统博尔索纳罗提出刑事指控，指控他伪造疫苗接种卡。联邦检察官现在必须决定是否受理此案。
item.description:
La policía de Brasil recomendó presentar cargos penales contra el expresidente Jair Bolsonaro, acusándolo de falsificar su cartilla de vacunación de covid. Ahora fiscales federales deberán decidir si van a tomar el caso. https://t.co/mSTFq72rr0

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰军队付出了高昂的代价来捍卫他们去年抵御俄罗斯进攻所取得的微小成果。他们说，俄罗斯人付出的代价要高得多。
item.description:
Ukrainian troops pay a high price to defend small gains they made last year against Russian assaults. They say the Russians pay a far higher cost. https://t.co/S5JA0ucCEz

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 据两位熟悉该计划的人士透露，根据一项即将成为法律的支出协议，美国将切断向加沙巴勒斯坦人提供援助的主要联合国机构提供的资金。
item.description:
The United States would cut off funding for the main U.N. agency that provides aid to Palestinians in Gaza under a spending agreement on track to soon become law, according to two people familiar with the plan. https://t.co/rCMUs0rJ4v

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 周三公布的官方选举结果显示，前将军普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）在上个月的印尼总统选举中获胜，证实了非官方预测。
item.description:
Prabowo Subianto, a former general, won last month’s presidential election in Indonesia, official results released on Wednesday showed, confirming unofficial projections. https://t.co/yRzoAbF8AE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 越南国家主席邬文通的离任可能会对该国的经济前景产生影响，因为他在很大程度上扮演着礼仪性的角色。
item.description:
The departure of the Vietnamese president, Vo Van Thuong, who occupied a largely ceremonial role, could have implications for the country’s economic future https://t.co/omlFGTGVRn

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 利奥-瓦拉德卡是谁？周三宣布下台的爱尔兰领导人的职业生涯。
item.description:
Who is Leo Varadkar? A look at the career of an Irish leader who announced on Wednesday that he was stepping down. https://t.co/98wQxscoS0

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 英国数据隐私监管机构正在审查一份报告，该报告称有人试图获取威尔士王妃凯瑟琳住院期间的私人医疗记录。
item.description:
Britain’s data privacy watchdog is examining a report that an attempt was made to access the private medical records of Catherine, Princess of Wales, while she was in hospital. https://t.co/8wxgrqU18a

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 据越南国家媒体报道，越南总统邬文通因违反共产党条例而辞职。其明显不当行为的性质尚不清楚。
item.description:
President Vo Van Thuong of Vietnam has resigned after violating Communist Party regulations, state media reported. The nature of his apparent wrongdoing was unclear. https://t.co/mDvRzKbHLC

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：爱尔兰总理利奥-瓦拉德卡（Leo Varadkar）宣布他将辞去爱尔兰及其政党领导人的职务。
item.description:
Breaking News: Prime Minister Leo Varadkar of Ireland announced he would step down as the leader of the country and his party. https://t.co/iqGydC9T6q

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 长期以来，南苏丹一直受到气候变化加剧的灾害的影响，如反复发生的干旱和洪水。现在，酷热正迫使这个世界上最年轻的国家关闭学校。
item.description:
South Sudan has long been hit by climate change-exacerbated disasters like recurring droughts and floods. Now, extreme heat is forcing the world’s youngest nation to close its schools. https://t.co/6VQn6JEFln

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 尽管美国心存疑虑，但乌克兰人说，保卫战略价值不大的地方值得付出伤亡和武器代价，因为俄罗斯人付出的代价更大。
item.description:
Despite U.S. doubts, Ukrainians say that defending places with little strategic value is worth the cost in casualties and weapons, because Russians pay more. https://t.co/F2m2Z7Q8I5

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 青铜时代，英格兰东部曾有一个小型农耕社区，在一场大火夷为平地之前曾短暂繁荣。定居点的遗迹保存完好，让人们得以一窥 3000 年前英国的乡村生活。
item.description:
During the Bronze Age, a small farming community briefly flourished in eastern England before a fire tore through the compound. The remains of the settlement are superbly preserved, offering a glimpse of village life in Britain 3,000 years ago. https://t.co/yvHLLjVBu7

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 尽管韩日两国之间存在着长期的敌对关系，但韩国的棒球迷还是对来自日本的超级巨星大谷翔平（Shohei Ohtani）青睐有加。"一位资深的韩国体育记者说："如果你是棒球迷，你就会欣赏这样的人才。
item.description:
Baseball fans in South Korea have embraced Shohei Ohtani, the superstar from Japan, despite the longtime rivalry between the two countries. “If you’re a baseball fan, you appreciate that kind of talent,” one veteran South Korean sports journalist said. https://t.co/TFtcvx7azM

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 随着香港领导人接受中国自上而下的政治文化，许多人认为这座城市的活力和生机正在逐渐消失。
item.description:
As Hong Kong’s leaders embrace China’s top-down political culture, many believe the city’s dynamism and vitality are slipping away. https://t.co/QYqJwDloWt

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 在同意讨论入侵拉法的替代方案一天后，本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理说没有替代方案。
item.description:
A day after agreeing to discuss alternatives to invading Rafah, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said there was no alternative. https://t.co/Pfcsaz9Jl8

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 马萨诸塞州一位退伍军人的家人发现了一批来自日本冲绳的藏品，包括绘画、陶器、卷轴和一幅复杂的手绘地图，并向联邦调查局报告了这一发现。这些文物已被归还。
item.description:
A veteran’s family in Massachusetts discovered a cache of items from Okinawa, Japan, including paintings and pottery, scrolls and an intricate hand-drawn map, and reported the discovery to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The artifacts were returned. https://t.co/j0nteywKrT

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 盖蒂图片社警告说，威尔士王妃凯瑟琳拍摄的一张女王伊丽莎白二世的照片已被 "数字增强"，这增加了对王室与公众沟通的审查。
item.description:
Getty Images advirtió que una foto de la reina Isabel II tomada por Catalina, la princesa de Gales, había sido “optimizada digitalmente”, aumentando el escrutinio sobre la comunicación de la familia real con el público. https://t.co/0qK3DrUNDb

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 执政党的候选人是前总理阿马杜-巴。被许多人视为主要挑战者的巴希鲁-迪奥马耶-法耶刚刚出狱。另外还有 17 名候选人。
item.description:
The governing party’s candidate is Amadou Ba, a former prime minister. The man many see as the main challenger, Bassirou Diomaye Faye, was just released from jail. Then there are 17 other candidates. https://t.co/dbs91QdD9R

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024
